Home → Recommendations & reviews → Young Adult

Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Wonder Woman: Warbringer by Leigh Bardugo

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jan 16, 2018

Wonder Woman: Warbringer blends comic books and YA, mythology and modernity, and action and characterisation.

It Only Happens in the Movies by Holly Bourne

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Jan 11, 2018

Kate found It Only Happens in the Movies hilarious, lovely, moving and heartbreaking.

Turtles All The Way Down by John Green

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jan 9, 2018

Turtles All The Way Down is a smart book filled with dark humour which will stay with you long after the final page.

Things a Bright Girl Can Do by Sally Nicholls

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Jan 2, 2018

Amélie recommends Things a Bright Girl Can Do to fans of history and romance.

The Dollmaker of Krakow by R. M. Romero, illustrated by Tomislav Tomić

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jan 2, 2018

The Dollmaker of Krakow is an astounding, gorgeously-written debut novel.

New Young Adult books for January 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 29, 2017

Exciting new titles from Philippa Gregory, Emily Barr and Kerry Drewery

The Loneliest Girl in the Universe by Lauren James

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Dec 21, 2017

The Loneliest Girl in the Universe will appeal to fans of science fiction, adventure and romance alike.

Alex, Approximately, by Jenn Bennett

Written by Rachael Vickery · Published Dec 18, 2017

Alex, Approximately follows a teenage film buff as she rekindles her relationship with her father, forms new friendships and tries to track down a mysterious internet friend over one epic summer.

The Treatment, by C. L. Taylor

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Dec 13, 2017

The Treatment is a pacy, gripping novel that will appeal to anyone who enjoys thrillers.

Genuine Fraud by E. Lockhart

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Dec 7, 2017

Genuine Fraud is a great book, full of twists and turns.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
